alert.note: Alert for Boone; Kanawha; Northwest Raleigh (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Kanawha, northwestern Raleigh and southeastern Boone Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Bald Knob, or 18 miles west of Beckley, moving northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bald Knob, Whitesville, Sylvester, Dorothy, Leewood, Stickney, Naoma, Prenter, Arnett and Eskdale. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
